a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Drug overdose death rate by drug type, United States, 1999 to 2020
Annual number of deaths in the United States from drug overdose per 100,000 people.
Overdoses can result from intentional excessive use of a substance, but can also result from 'poisoning' where
substances have been altered or mixed, such that the user is unaware of the drug's potency.
Data source: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention WONDER
Note: Opioids include prescription pain-relief drugs; synthetic opioids, excluding methadone; and other opioids, such as heroin.
